author: Nick Halter
title: Hotel Ivy shows off $8 million renovation (photos)
text:
4 photos Subterranean bar Constantine. Hotel Ivy may only be seven years old, but the downtown Minneapolis luxury hotel is already wrapping up an $8 million renovation project. "Things change. Lifestyle trends today are different today than they were back then," said Paul Wischermann , president of Minnetonka-based Wischermann Partners , the manager of the hotel. "The expectations of luxury travelers have evolved." The renovation includes redesigned restaurant and lounge space, with Minneapolis-based ESG Architects serving as designer. Jester Concepts is the operator of the new Monello Restaurant and three bars, including the speakeasy Constantine. Other improvements include an outdoor patio and bar, new furnishings in all 136 rooms, a redesigned hotel lobby, new carpeting and wall covers in the hallway. Room and corridor renovations were done by The Gettys Group Inc ., while ESG Architects handled the restaurant spaces. Heartland Realty Investors Inc. of Minneapolis bought the hotel in 2013 . It's part of Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide's Luxury Collection. Andrew Finsness is the general manager of Hotel Ivy.
